greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative function with a(p^e)=(-1)^(e-1)
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
formula: Multiplicative function with a(p^e)=(-1)^(e-1) for any prime p and any positive exponent e.
a(n) = 1 when n is a squarefree number (A005117).
mathematica: a[n_] := (-1)^(PrimeOmega[n] - PrimeNu[n]); Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 24 2017, after _Reinhard Zumkeller_ *)
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(f=factor(n)[,2]); prod(i=1,#f,-(-1)^f[i]) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 09 2015
return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, [(-1)**(f[i] - 1) for i in f]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 20 2017
results.author: _Gerard P. Michon_, Jul 05 2009
